Class PaperScissorsRockPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • PaperScissorsRockPanel

  • public class PaperScissorsRockPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    An instance of PaperScissorsRockPanel is a component of VillainsLairPanel. It contains all the components related to the paper scissors rock minigame.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      A string representation of this panel, used by the CardLayout in interactivePanel.

      A string representation of this panel, used by the CardLayout in interactive panel.
      private javax.swing.JPanel endGamePanel
      A panel belonging to interactivePanelCardLayout which displays the result of a concluded (non-drawn) game.
      private javax.swing.JPanel gamePanel
      The subpanel which contains the choice images and the interactive panel.
      private javax.swing.JPanel interactivePanel
      A subpanel of gamePanel which holds all interactive elements.

      The CardLayout used by this panel.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      PaperScissorsRockPanel​(VillainsLairPanel villainsLairPanel, Hero hero, Villain villain)
      Creates a new panel which displays the game play for a single game of paper scissors rock.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      private void addChoosePanel​()
      Create and populate the choose panel; a panel owned by interactive panel which has buttons to select a choice of paper, scissors or rock.
      private void addDrawPanel​()
      Create and populate the draw panel; a panel owned by the interactive panel which displays the result of a drawn game and prompts the player to play again.
      private void addEndGamePanel​()
      Create and populate the end game panel; a panel owned by the interactive panel which displays the result of a concluded, non-drawn game.
      private void addGamePanel​()
      Create and populate the game panel, which holds images of the current choices for the hero and villain, and contains the interactive panel.
      private void addHeadingPanel​()
      Create and populate the heading panel, which contains an introduction to the minigame.
      private void addInteractivePanel​()
      Create and populate the interactive panel.
      private void addPowerUpPanel​()
      Create and populate the powerUp panel, which implements the Mindreader and Gambler abilities.
      private void buildPanel​()
      Creates and adds all components belonging to this instance of PaperScissorsRockPanel.
      private void endGame​()
      Passes the result of this minigame back to the VillainsLairPanel, which in turn displays a summary depending on if the player won or lost.
      private void manageGameOutcome​(java.lang.String outcome)
      Given a game outcome (win, loss, draw), responds appropriately by switching the current view of interactivePanel to the corresponding panel (endGamePanel or drawPanel).
      private void refreshEndGamePanel​(java.lang.String outcome, boolean wonViaTiebreaker)
      Refreshes the endGame panel by creating components and setting their attributed depening on the result of the game, including if the game was won via a Tiebreaker power-up.
      private void refreshGamePanel​()
      Refreshes gamePanel by updating labels to show the correct image.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PaperScissorsRockPanel

        public PaperScissorsRockPanel​(VillainsLairPanel villainsLairPanel,
                              Hero hero,
                              Villain villain)
        Creates a new panel which displays the game play for a single game of paper scissors rock.
        Parameters:
        villainsLairPanel - The panel which this panel is being added to.
        hero - The hero playing the game.
        villain - The villain playing the game.

    • Method Detail

      • buildPanel

        private void buildPanel​()
        Creates and adds all components belonging to this instance of PaperScissorsRockPanel.

      • addHeadingPanel

        private void addHeadingPanel​()
        Create and populate the heading panel, which contains an introduction to the minigame.

      • addPowerUpPanel

        private void addPowerUpPanel​()
        Create and populate the powerUp panel, which implements the Mindreader and Gambler abilities. This panel is only visible to the player if their hero is a Gambler or is using a Mindreader power-up.

      • addGamePanel

        private void addGamePanel​()
        Create and populate the game panel, which holds images of the current choices for the hero and villain, and contains the interactive panel.

      • addInteractivePanel

        private void addInteractivePanel​()
        Create and populate the interactive panel. This panel holds all interactive elements of the game and uses a card layout to respond to the player's choices.

      • addChoosePanel

        private void addChoosePanel​()
        Create and populate the choose panel; a panel owned by interactive panel which has buttons to select a choice of paper, scissors or rock.

      • addEndGamePanel

        private void addEndGamePanel​()
        Create and populate the end game panel; a panel owned by the interactive panel which displays the result of a concluded, non-drawn game.

      • addDrawPanel

        private void addDrawPanel​()
        Create and populate the draw panel; a panel owned by the interactive panel which displays the result of a drawn game and prompts the player to play again.

      • manageGameOutcome

        private void manageGameOutcome​(java.lang.String outcome)
        Given a game outcome (win, loss, draw), responds appropriately by switching the current view of interactivePanel to the corresponding panel (endGamePanel or drawPanel). In the case of a draw, this method checks for a Tiebreaker and treats the game as a win if one is found.
        Parameters:
        outcome - A string representing the outcome of the game.

      • refreshGamePanel

        private void refreshGamePanel​()
        Refreshes gamePanel by updating labels to show the correct image.

      • refreshEndGamePanel

        private void refreshEndGamePanel​(java.lang.String outcome,
                                 boolean wonViaTiebreaker)
        Refreshes the endGame panel by creating components and setting their attributed depening on the result of the game, including if the game was won via a Tiebreaker power-up.
        Parameters:
        outcome - A string representation of the outcome of the game.
        wonViaTiebreaker - A boolean showing how the game was won. True if a Tiebreaker was used, False otherwise.

      • endGame

        private void endGame​()
        Passes the result of this minigame back to the VillainsLairPanel, which in turn displays a summary depending on if the player won or lost.
